title: Could Brian Thomas Jr. be a legitimate trade target for Patriots this offseason?
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots consider Brian Thomas Jr. as potential trade target to boost their offensive lineup for the 2026 season.
Thomas had a standout NFL rookie year but saw reduced performance in 2025, increasing trade speculation.
New England may need to offer high draft picks to acquire Thomas from the Jacksonville Jaguars.

title: 3 takeaways from Team USA men’s hockey’s OT win over Sweden in Olympics
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Team USA advanced to the Olympic semifinals after Quinn Hughes' overtime goal secured a 2-1 win against Sweden.
Charlie McAvoy, playing without a face shield, delivered multiple hits and ranked third in ice time for Team USA.
Four Bruins players remain in the Olympic gold-medal race, with USA's McAvoy and Swayman, and Finland's Jokiharju and Korpisalo.

title: Pittsfield armored vehicle company is largest ICE contract in Mass.
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Lenco Industries secured $5.2 million in ICE contracts, becoming Massachusetts' largest supplier of militarized vehicles to federal agents.
Governor Maura Healey criticized ICE contracts but Lenco benefited from state grants to modernize production and increase jobs.
Lenco's BearCat vehicles have been used in high-profile ICE operations, despite company's larger focus on defense and emergency services.

title: Former State Police union head, lobbyist get more prison time for fraud, racketeering
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Dana Pullman, former State Police union president, sentenced to two years in prison and ordered to pay $43,915 restitution.
Anne Lynch, former union lobbyist, received a 15-month sentence plus one year supervised release, with $41,795 restitution owed.
Convictions involve racketeering, fraud, obstruction of justice, and tax crimes related to misuse of union funds and kickbacks.

title: Boston 25 News head meteorologist Kevin Lemanowicz departing after 3 decades with the station
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Kevin Lemanowicz, head meteorologist at Boston 25 News, will depart the station after nearly 30 years.
Lemanowicz's last day as chief meteorologist will be February 27, marking the end of his tenure.
He has reported on significant events like the 2011 tornadoes, 2015 snowstorms, and 2023 Leominster flooding.

title: Red Sox release statement after outcry over flawed jersey design
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Red Sox released a revised statement addressing fan concerns over their 2026 home jersey design flaws.
The overlapping design elements on the jerseys led to online criticism, prompting a redesign ahead of Opening Day.
The Red Sox clarified that Fanatics executed the original design accurately and remains a valued partner.

title: Pawtucket police find firearms in ice rink shooter’s storage locker, identify ‘courageous citizens’ who intervened
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Police discovered firearms and ammunition in the storage locker of Robert Dorgan, the suspect in the Pawtucket ice rink shooting.
Bystanders Michael Black, Robert Rattenni, and Ryan Cordeiro subdued the shooter, aiding victims alongside former EMTs and a nurse.
The shooter, Robert Dorgan, killed his ex-wife and son in a targeted dispute; three surviving victims are in critical condition.

title: MBTA announces service changes and suspensions for March
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: MBTA announces March service suspensions on Orange Line and four Commuter Rail lines for signal and modernization upgrades.
Orange Line service between Back Bay and Forest Hills will be suspended from Feb. 28 to March 8 with shuttle replacements.
Commuter Rail lines affected include Fitchburg, Haverhill, Lowell, and Newburyport/Rockport with various shuttle and travel time adjustments.

title: Rafael Devers reacts to Red Sox exec’s ‘pick up a glove’ comment
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Rafael Devers, now with the Giants, declined to comment on Red Sox exec Tom Werner's criticism over position refusal.
Devers, traded from the Red Sox in 2025, opposed playing first base after injuries left the position vacant.
Devers batted .236 with 20 home runs for the Giants after his trade from Boston in 2025.

title: Adam Schefter maps out potential price for Patriots in Maxx Crosby trade
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Adam Schefter suggests a steep price for Maxx Crosby, potentially involving a Micah Parsons-type trade package.
Maxx Crosby's dissatisfaction with the Raiders stems from a communication mishap regarding an injury decision last December.
The New England Patriots, needing pass-rushing talent, might be interested in trading a first-round pick for Crosby.
